chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
X: Type
R: X -> X -> Prop
m: nat
n: nat
y: X
x: X

Goal:
rel_iter (n + m) x y <-> (exists a : X, rel_iter n x a /\ rel_iter m a y)

Premises:
rel_iter = fix rel_iter (n : nat) : X -> X -> Prop := match n with | 0 => eq | S n0 => fun x z : X => exists y : X, R x y /\ rel_iter n0 y z end : nat -> X -> X -> Prop Arguments rel_iter _%nat_scope
FinFun.bSurjective = fun (n : nat) (f : nat -> nat) => forall y : nat, y < n -> exists x : nat, x < n /\ f x = y : nat -> (nat -> nat) -> Prop Arguments FinFun.bSurjective _%nat_scope _%function_scope
List.in_map_iff : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A) (y : B), List.In y (List.map f l) < -> (exists x : A, f x = y /\ List.In x l)
FinFun.bInjective = fun (n : nat) (f : nat -> nat) => forall x y : nat, x < n -> y < n -> f x = f y -> x = y : nat -> (nat -> nat) -> Prop Arguments FinFun.bInjective _%nat_scope _%function_scope
List.in_flat_map : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> list B) (l : list A) (y : B), List.In y (List.flat_map f l) < -> (exists x : A, List.In x l /\ List.In y (f x))
Nat.add_succ_l : forall n m : nat, S n + m = S (n + m)
ListDec.decidable_eq = fun A : Type => forall x y : A, Decidable.decidable (x = y) : Type -> Prop Arguments ListDec.decidable_eq _%type_scope
List.Exists_exists : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), List.Exists P l < -> (exists x : A, List.In x l /\ P x)
Nat.sqrt_sqrt_up_exact : forall a : nat, 0 <= a -> Nat.sqrt a = Nat.sqrt_up a < -> (exists b : nat, 0 <= b /\ a = b * b)
BinInt.Z.sqrt_sqrt_up_exact : forall a : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 a -> BinInt.Z.sqrt a = BinInt.Z.sqrt_up a < -> (exists b : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 b /\ a = BinInt.Z.mul b b)
FinFun.bFun = fun (n : nat) (f : nat -> nat) => forall x : nat, x < n -> f x < n : nat -> (nat -> nat) -> Prop Arguments FinFun.bFun _%nat_scope _%function_scope
BinInt.Z.bits_iff_neg_ex : forall a : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt a BinNums.Z0 < -> (exists k : BinNums.Z, forall m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt k m -> BinInt.Z.testbit a m = true)
FinFun.Injective = fun (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) => forall x y : A, f x = f y -> x = y : forall A B : Type, (A -> B) -> Prop Arguments FinFun.Injective {A B}%type_scope _%function_scope
BinInt.Z.are_bits : forall f : BinNums.Z -> bool, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq eq) f -> (exists n : BinNums.Z, forall m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 m -> f m = BinInt.Z.testbit n m) < -> (exists k : BinNums.Z, forall m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le k m -> f m = f k)
BinInt.Z.sqrt_up_eq_succ_iff_square : forall a : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 a -> BinInt.Z.sqrt_up (BinInt.Z.succ a) = BinInt.Z.succ (BinInt.Z.sqrt_up a) < -> (exists b : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 b /\ a = BinInt.Z.mul b b)
Nat.sqrt_up_eq_succ_iff_square : forall a : nat, 0 <= a -> Nat.sqrt_up (S a) = S (Nat.sqrt_up a) < -> (exists b : nat, 0 <= b /\ a = b * b)
BinNat.N.sqrt_up_eq_succ_iff_square : forall a : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.le BinNums.N0 a -> BinNat.N.sqrt_up (BinNat.N.succ a) = BinNat.N.succ (BinNat.N.sqrt_up a) < -> (exists b : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.le BinNums.N0 b /\ a = BinNat.N.mul b b)
BinInt.Z.lt = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.lt (_ _)%Z_scope
BinNat.N.le = fun x y : BinNums.N => BinNat.N.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> Prop Arguments BinNat.N.le (_ _)%N_scope
BinNat.N.lt = fun x y : BinNums.N => BinNat.N.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> Prop Arguments BinNat.N.lt (_ _)%N_scope
BinInt.Z.le = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
minus_Sn_m : forall n m : nat, m <= n -> S (n - m) = S n - m
BinInt.Z.sqrt_eq_succ_iff_square : forall a : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 a -> BinInt.Z.sqrt (BinInt.Z.succ a) = BinInt.Z.succ (BinInt.Z.sqrt a) < -> (exists b : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt BinNums.Z0 b /\ BinInt.Z.succ a = BinInt.Z.mul b b)
BinInt.Z.divide = fun x y : BinNums.Z => exists z : BinNums.Z, y = BinInt.Z.mul z x : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.divide (_ _)%Z_scope
List.in_or_app : forall (A : Type) (l m : list A) (a : A), List.In a l \/ List.In a m -> List.In a (l ++ m)
List.in_app_or : forall (A : Type) (l m : list A) (a : A), List.In a (l ++ m) -> List.In a l \/ List.In a m
List.Forall_image : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list B), List.Forall (fun y : B => exists x : A, y = f x) l < -> (exists l' : list A, l = List.map f l')
FinFun.Surjective = fun (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) => forall y : B, exists x : A, f x = y : forall A B : Type, (A -> B) -> Prop Arguments FinFun.Surjective {A B}%type_scope _%function_scope
Init.Nat.div = fun x y : nat => match y with | 0 => y | S y' => fst (divmod x y' 0 y') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.div (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.div_add : forall a b c : nat, c <> 0 -> (a + b * c) / c = a / c + b
mul = fix mul (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | S p => m + mul p m end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments mul (_ _)%nat_scope
